heroDescription: St. Petersburg, Florida, is a vibrant coastal city known for its arts scene and beautiful waterfront.
landscapeDescription: The economy of St. Petersburg is diverse, with strengths in tourism, healthcare, and technology. The city's growth is supported by a favorable climate and a burgeoning job market.
uniqueNeeds: Focus on sustainable growth in tourism and healthcare while addressing housing affordability.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: St. Petersburg's tech and tourism sectors are vulnerable to economic shifts. Real estate prices may face bubble risks; diversify investments and prepare for hurricane impacts.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), St. Petersburg's economy grew by 3.5% last year, driven by tourism and healthcare expansions.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in St. Petersburg is $58,000, reflecting a mix of industries and job opportunities.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in St. Petersburg increasingly focus on retirement planning and real estate investment strategies.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), the cost of living in St. Petersburg is 5% lower than the national average, making it an attractive place to live.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), St. Petersburg's real estate market has seen a 10% increase in home prices over the past year, raising affordability concerns.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), St. Petersburg's business climate is improving, with a focus on attracting tech startups and supporting local enterprises.
